com.example.app.db

Class DatabaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.example.app.db.DatabaseHelper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DatabaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    Custom implementation of the SQLiteOpenHelper Android class. This helper will create a database with the name Device.db. In that database file it will create at this point in time one table mapped in the DatabaseContract.PersonEntry class. To add more tables, in addition to creating the respective Entry classes on the DatabaseContract class, it is need to create the proper SQL DDL statements as shown with String variables SQL_CREATE_ENTRIES and SQL_DELETE_ENTRIES.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseHelper

        public DatabaseHelper(android.content.Context context)
        Default constructor for this class. Receives an instance of the application context to create the database file. Calls it's super constructor, passing the context, database name, an optional factory and the current version number.
        Parameters:
        context - Application's Context instance

    • Method Detail

        public void onCreate(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Called the very first time the Helper is instantiated. Will execute the SQL_DELETE_ENTRIES sql code.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                      int oldVersion,
                      int newVersion)
        Called when the is incremented, e.g. from 1 to 2. This provides the option to perform a migration, from existing records to the new schema. Database versions should only change when the table schema is altered or new tables are added. DANGER! Current migration strategy is to drop all existing tables along with their records. Upgrading the database as is will result in all records being deleted.
        Specified by:
        onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - SQLiteDatabase instance to perform sql statements
        oldVersion - Version number we are upgrading from.
        newVersion - Version number we are upgrading to.

      • onDowngrade

        public void onDowngrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                        int oldVersion,
                        int newVersion)
        This provides the option to rollback to a previous database version schema. Database versions should only change when the table schema is altered or new tables are added. DANGER! Current migration strategy is to drop all existing tables along with their records. Downgrading the database as is will result in all records being deleted.
        Overrides:
        onDowngrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - SQLiteDatabase instance to perform sql statements
        oldVersion - Version number we are downgrading to.
        newVersion - Version number we are downgrading from.
